executive_summary: Companies in the cryotherapy industry serve a range of downstream markets. The two largest are private and government funded healthcare markets. During the period, an influx of funding for Medicaid and Medicare bolstered downstream demand from the government market, as growing funding pushed more consumers to cryotherapy companies. Opposing this growth was a stagnation in the number of people on private health insurance plans during the same period. This stagnation was partially caused by an increasing average cost of private insurance. For out-of-pocket patients, disposable income is a lead indicator for demand. Throughout the period increasing per capita income led to growth of the market, however, increasing interest rates in 2022 led to a large decrease in disposable income, limiting the growth of the downstream segment slightly.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Enhancements in per capita disposable income
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Through 2024, enhancements in per capita disposable income and total healthcare expenditure, grew significantly despite impending economic problems.
Consequently, swelling healthcare expenditure means that more resources are allocated for services in the healthcare sector, including cryogenic therapies.
The trend of increasing funding for government programs such as Medicaid and Medicare contributes to the industry growth.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite lack of formal approval by the FDA, the cryotherapy industry has gained significant popularity courtesy of endorsements from celebrities such as Daniel Craig, Demi Moore, and Jennifer Aniston.
The aging population represents an untapped demographic for the cryotherapy industry. Cryotherapy can help address age-related problems like arthritis, muscle soreness, and inflammation.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Impact of increased Medicare and Medicaid funding
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Greater funding for Medicare and Medicaid could directly benefit the cryotherapy industry by enhancing accessibility for patients.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry provide general or specialized outpatient cryogenic services.

negative_impact_factors: Low - Steady Barriers To Entry Level

opportunities: High Performance Drivers - Per capita disposable income
threats: Number of people with private health insurance

key_trends: The Cryotherapy industry is expected to experience significant growth, despite impending economic problems.
Increased per capita disposable income and total healthcare expenditure have provided more people the opportunity to access industry services including cryotherapy.
A major driver of this growth is the reported health benefits like pain relief, weight loss and even potential cancer prevention that this non-conventional therapeutic approach provides.
Despite not being approved by the FDA, cryotherapy presents a promising future for the health and wellness sector.
Cryotherapy care providers' role has implications for public health. A mix of federal, state and local laws, agencies and regulators oversee providers to ensure patient safety and standards.
The largest market for cryotherapy services is the government, with a focus on Medicaid and Medicare programs. Funding from the government can make or break demand from this segment.
The private market has stagnated due to rising healthcare costs and a lack of affordability for consumers.
Competition is high, first adopters of new technology get a large advantage.
Companies that offer the most amount of services will be able to draw in the highest number of patients.

market_segmentation.segment_description: The largest downstream market is government, but this relates predominately to Medicaid and Medicare programs, as well as any other government related program. Medicare is the federal healthcare program largely for people over the age of 65, but also includes people under the age of 65 with certain disabilities. Medicaid is a joint federal and state healthcare program for people with limited income. Due to the sheer amount of people using these health plans, makes government the largest market. This segment is expected to grow through the period as funding for these programs are set to increase, likely bringing more people into the market.

The private downstream market is in reference to clients with private health insurance, insurance that is usually purchased by a company for its employees, or purchased individually. During the period rising healthcare prices has slowed private healthcare growth as an increasing number of consumers are unable to afford the high cost. This in turn, has slowed the demand from the private market as fewer people are becoming privately insured.

Out of pocket simply refers to people who paid out of pocket for cryo services, without the aid of a private or federal health insurance program. As private health insurance premiums grow, more consumer must turn to out of pocket costs for individual procedures and therapies. Consequently, out of pocket payments are expected to increase during the period.

products_and_services.product_description: Ice pack treatment is the most popular form of cryotherapy, which utilizes frozen ice packs for pain treatment, swelling control and muscular healing.
Whole body cryotherapy is a form of more intense therapy aimed at the entire body.
Instant ice pack therapy is a type of ice pack treatment that becomes frozen immediately but is not reusable.
Partial body cryotherapy is a form of more intense therapy aimed at specific parts of the body, someone who just had knee surgery might opt for this form of treatment.

Internal cryotherapy, also known as cryosurgery, is a method of surgery performed by making a small incision in the patient, and inserting a cryoprobe, which is then guided using MRI or ultrasound to the problem area. Cryosurgery is most commonly used in stopping the spread of cancerous tumors in the body.

tier_2_suppliers: Medical Supplies Wholesaling in the US
Drug, Cosmetic & Toiletry Wholesaling in the US
Primary Care Doctors in the US
tier_1_buyers: Health & Medical Insurance in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The industry's revenue performance depends on active consumer spending. With more disposable income, consumers are more likely to splurge on cryogenic services.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Number of People With Private Health Insurance
demand_determinants.determinant_description: The number of people with private health insurance includes coverage either provided by employers or purchased directly from an insurer or a health maintenance organization. As more people enrolled in private health insurance, more people are able to use cryotherapy. Falling number of people with private insurance presents a potential threat to the industry.

When income rises, individuals are able to afford industry services, either through insurance or out-of-pocket expenses. Growing per capita disposable income represents an opportunity for the industry.

Total health expenditure includes public and private expenditures for the services of physicians and other medical professionals, dentists, home healthcare agencies, nursing homes, hospitals and health insurers; goods such as prescription and nonprescription drugs and other medical supplies; investment in structures and equipment; and government health programs.

basis_points.basis_description: With new technology on the horizon, the race to work it into cryotherapy services is high. As a result, competition is high, first adopters get a large advantage.

Companies that offer the most amount of services will be able to draw in the highest number of patients. Included in this is insurance acceptance, the companies that accept the widest range of insurance carriers benefit more than those who don't.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Profit, measured as earnings before interest and taxes, is anticipated to account for 16.9% of industry revenue in 2024. Profit is dependent on the type of service being provided. For example, cryosurgery costs $204.00 on average, while ordinary cryotherapy sessions cost $40.00. Rising per capita disposable income likely boosted demand for higher priced services.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry is experiencing a low level of both the rate of new patents and the concentration of patents in the industry. This creates an environment where the threat of new technologies driving disruption is low. Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified. The spread of market segments suggests that there are limited entry points other than those already served by incumbent operators.

The industry is experiencing a low level of both the rate of new patents and the concentration of patents in the industry. This creates an environment where the threat of new technologies driving disruption is low.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Funding for Medicaid and Medicare is Politicized
volatility_points.volatility_description: Outside of the two trust funds set up to fund the service, both Medicaid and Medicare receive funding from Congress. Funding for these programs are highly politicized in the US Congress and can receive surges in funding, or cuts to funding. More recently, the latter has been the trend, 2024, physician pay is expected to be cut.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Economic Inequality Causes Swings in Demand
volatility_points.volatility_description: Growing economic inequality in the US has slowly added volatility to this industry. As the gap widens between the top income groups and the rest of the US and increasing number of people are unable to afford services in the industry. This trend was likely exacerbated in 2020, as higher paying jobs stayed, while lower paying jobs were either furloughed or even terminated.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Ice Pack Treatment Gets the Highest Usage Among the Service Offerings
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Ice pack treatment is the most popular form of cryotherapy, Which utilizes frozen ice packs for pain treatment, swelling control and muscular healing. Ice packs are the easiest cryotherapy method for simple pain management and recovery, so they are by far the most used service.

Internal cryotherapy, also known as cryosurgery, is a method of surgery performed by making a small incision in the patient, and inserting a cryoprobe, which is then guided using MRI or ultrasound to the problem area. Cryosurgery is most commonly used in stopping the spread of cancerous tumors in the body. Thus as more people go to the doctors and specialists, which is indicated by growth in private insurances members and growing Medicare and Medicaid users.

FAQs.question: What is the funding situation for Medicaid and Medicare in the US?
FAQs.answer: Outside of the two trust funds set up to fund the service, both Medicaid and Medicare receive funding from Congress. Funding for these programs are highly politicized in the US Congress and can receive surges in funding, or cuts to funding. More recently, the latter has been the trend, 2024, physician pay is expected to be cut.

FAQs.question: How does economic inequality impact demand in this industry?
FAQs.answer: Growing economic inequality in the US has slowly added volatility to this industry. As the gap widens between the top income groups and the rest of the US and increasing number of people are unable to afford services in the industry. This trend was likely exacerbated in 2020, as higher paying jobs stayed, while lower paying jobs were either furloughed or even terminated.

What is the level of industry assistance?
